data.name: AboutDialogCheckingForUpdateError
data.value: Update check failed. Please check your internet connection.

data.name: AboutDialogLastVersionUsed
data.value: You are using the latest version of AdGuard.

data.name: AboutDialogProgramProtected
data.value: Warning: this program is protected by copyright and international conventions. Illegal copying or distribution of this program or its parts may result in severe administrative and criminal punishments.

data.name: AdBlockerSettingsAutoActivateHelp
data.value: Auto-activation of the language-specific filters is an adaptive mechanism that switches the language-specific filters appropriately to the web sites you visit.

data.name: AdBlockerSettingsDescription
data.value: The ad blocker module removes all ad banners and messages from the web pages you visit. AdGuard features several ad filters that you can fine-tune to remove the unwanted elements.

data.name: AdBlockerSettingsDoNotBlockUsefulAds
data.value: Do not block search ads and self-promotion

data.name: AdBlockerSettingsDoNotBlockUsefulAdsHelp
data.value: This setting turns on a special filter for unblocking search ads and self-promotion of websites. For example, a context-based ad which appears in a search result.

data.name: AdBlockerSettingsEnableDescription
data.value: When enabled, AdGuard will block ads

data.name: AdBlockerSettingsInstalledFiltersDescription
data.value: List of all installed, enabled, and disabled ad filters.

data.name: AdBlockerSettingsInstalledFiltersWarning
data.value: You have too many filters. It may slow down your web browsing significantly

data.name: AdBlockerSettingsSelectFilterUpdatePeriodHelp
data.value: You can change the AdGuard filter update period by choosing an option from the list. If you choose "Default", then each filter's "Expires" attribute defines the update check period for each filter accordingly. Otherwise, the chosen update check period defines the same update check period for all filters.

data.name: AdBlockerSettingsUsefulAdsExplanationButton
data.value: Find out which ads we consider useful

data.name: AddRuleDialogOptionAllWebsites
data.value: Apply the rule to all websites

data.name: AddRuleDialogOptionImportant
data.value: Give a higher priority to the rule

data.name: AddRuleDialogOptionThirdParty
data.value: Apply to third party requests only

data.name: AdvancedSettingsBlockWfpTeredoDescription
data.value: If enabled, AdGuard will block Teredo when the WFP driver is selected.

data.name: AdvancedSettingsBlockWfpTeredoName
data.value: Block Teredo when the WFP driver is selected

data.name: AdvancedSettingsDialogSubHeader
data.value: Changing these advanced settings can harm AdGuard's stability, security and performance. You should only continue if you are sure of what you are doing.

data.name: AdvancedSettingsEnableFilterEditorTooltipDescription
data.value: If enabled, a tooltip in the filter editor for the ad filter rules will be shown

data.name: AdvancedSettingsEnableFilterEditorTooltipName
data.value: Enable tooltip for ad filter rules

data.name: AdvancedSettingsEnablePopupNotificationsDescription
data.value: If enabled, AdGuard will be showing its own pop-up notifications

data.name: AdvancedSettingsFilteringExcludePathDescription
data.value: AdGuard will not filter applications at the specified paths.\nDifferent paths must be separated by semicolons.

data.name: AdvancedSettingsFilteringExcludePathName
data.value: Exclude app from filtering by entering the full path

data.name: AdvancedSettingsIsAbpFiltersDetectionEnabledDescription
data.value: If enabled, AdGuard will intercept filter subscription URLs (i.e. abp:subscribe and alike) and open a custom filter installation dialog.

data.name: AdvancedSettingsShowOnStartDescription
data.value: Check this option to show main window every time the program starts.

data.name: AdvancedSettingsShowOnStartName
data.value: Open main window at system start-up

data.name: AdvancedSettingsTcpFastOpenBlockDescription
data.value: If enabled, AdGuard will block TCP Fast Open in the Edge browser.\nTo apply settings you need to restart browser.

data.name: AdvancedSettingsUseLocalhostForInjectionsDescription
data.value: If enabled, AdGuard redirects local.adguard.com connections to localhost.

data.name: AdvancedSettingsUseRedirectDriverDescription
data.value: If this option is enabled, AdGuard intercepts all the traffic and redirects it to the local proxy server for further filtering. Otherwise, AdGuard will filter all the traffic on the fly, without redirecting it

data.name: AdvancedSettingsUseTls13Description
data.value: If this option is enabled, the latest ssl version (TLS v1.3) will be used. Otherwise, AdGuard will forcibly "downgrade" accepted ssl version to TLS v1.2 even if your agent supports TLS v1.3

data.name: AppInitDialogFilterCountersDescription
data.value: There are lots of companies monitoring your online activities. Enable this filter and forget about being tracked.

data.name: AppInitDialogFilterCountersTitle
data.value: Filter for counters and web analytics

data.name: BrowserApiUserFilterChangedMessageRuleAdded
data.value: A new rule was added to the User Filter:

data.name: BrowserApiUserFilterChangedMessageRuleRemoved
data.value: A rule was removed from the User Filter:

data.name: BrowserSettingsTdiWarning
data.value: The Modern UI app cannot be filtered using the TDI driver

data.name: BrowsersSettingsDescription
data.value: AdGuard automatically filters the traffic in browsers on the list. If the browser you use is not on the list, you can add it manually by selecting its executable file on your hard drive.

data.name: BrowsersSettingsProxyModeWarning
data.value: You are using AdGuard as an HTTP proxy. Note that in this mode all apps are being filtered, regardless of the 'Filtered apps' settings

data.name: BrowsingSecuritySettingsDescription
data.value: The browsing security module protects you from malicious and phishing websites. It won't let you install malware or become a victim of fraud.

data.name: BrowsingSecuritySettingsEnableHelp
data.value: Enable this module for protection against online threats.

data.name: BrowsingSecuritySettingsEnableSoundDescription
data.value: You will get sound notifications about blocked requests to malicious and phishing websites.

data.name: BrowsingSecuritySettingsNotifyDescription
data.value: AdGuard will notify you about blocked requests to malicious and phishing websites.

data.name: BrowsingSecuritySettingsTakePartInDevelopment
data.value: Take part in the development of the Browsing Security module

data.name: BrowsingSecuritySettingsTakePartInDevelopmentHelp
data.value: By setting this flag, you agree to submit anonymous security-related information to the AdGuard server.

data.name: CrashReportDialogText
data.value: Oops! Looks like AdGuard just crashed!\nPlease help us make AdGuard better — send an automatically recorded crash report and describe the sequence of actions that led to the crash. Thank you!

data.name: CustomFilterSubscriptionDialogDescriptionText
data.value: Enter the valid URL or file path of the filter into the input box below. You will be subscribed to that filter.

data.name: CustomFilterSubscriptionDialogTrustedDescription
data.value: Filters marked as trusted can use powerful filtering rules modifiers which can be dangerous in the wrong hands. Do not check this box unless you fully trust it.

data.name: CustomUserFilterSubscriptionDialogDescriptionText
data.value: Enter filter name and description into the input boxes below. This filter will be added to your active filters. Once it is created, you can edit it (i.e. create, delete and modify your own filter's rules), just as with the default "User filter"

data.name: EnterLicenseKeyError
data.value: You must enter a valid license key.

data.name: EvCertificateIgnoredPopupDescription
data.value: Connection to "https://{0}" has not been filtered. Click to filter anyway.

data.name: ExtendedUpdateDialogFiltersError
data.value: Error while checking for filter updates\\n

data.name: ExtensionsSettingsDescription
data.value: AdGuard can extend web site functionality, working as a cross-browser userscript manager.

data.name: FilterEditorSaveChangesDialog
data.value: Do you want to save changes?

data.name: FilterNameValidationError
data.value: Filter name is not valid. It must contain at least one character.

data.name: FilterSubscriptionDetectedDialogRequiredTitle
data.value: The subscription below will be installed as required:

data.name: GeneralSettingsAdguardHttpProxy
data.value: Use AdGuard as an HTTP proxy

data.name: GeneralSettingsAdguardHttpProxyHelp
data.value: AdGuard will not automatically intercept your application traffic. To enable Internet traffic filtering, you need to manually configure your browser to use AdGuard as a proxy server.

data.name: GeneralSettingsAutomaticallyFilterTrafficHelp
data.value: AdGuard will automatically filter all your Internet traffic using its network driver.

data.name: GeneralSettingsBetaChannelHelp
data.value: You can test the latest features of AdGuard by switching the update channel to 'Beta'.

data.name: GeneralSettingsHttpPortHelp
data.value: Don't forget to configure your browser to use AdGuard as a proxy server, accessible at 127.0.0.1 and using a port you specified for it.

data.name: GeneralSettingsHttpsProtocolHelp
data.value: AdGuard will filter secure (HTTPS) connections if this checkbox is checked.

data.name: GeneralSettingsIgnoreEvCertificates
data.value: Do not filter websites with EV certificates

data.name: GeneralSettingsIgnoreEvCertificatesHelp
data.value: Extended Validation (EV) SSL Certificates offer a stronger guarantee for which the owner of the website passed a thorough and globally-standardized identity verification process defined within the EV guidelines.

data.name: GeneralSettingsImportSettingsDescription
data.value: You need to restart AdGuard to apply imported settings. Start import and restart after successful importing?

data.name: GeneralSettingsImportSettingsVersionGreater
data.value: Please note that the current settings version, {1}, is older than the imported settings version, {0}. If any settings are missing in the imported file, the current values will be used.

data.name: GeneralSettingsImportSettingsVersionOlder
data.value: Please note that the current settings version, {1}, is newer than the imported settings version, {0}. If any settings are missing in the imported file, the current values will be used.

data.name: GeneralSettingsLanguageHelp
data.value: You can change the AdGuard user interface language by choosing the one you need from the list. \nAttention!\nThe program will have to restart in order for the changes to take place.

data.name: GeneralSettingsLaunchAtStartuplHelp
data.value: This checkbox affects only the AdGuard UI, and doesn't prevent the AdGuard service from launching at startup.

data.name: GeneralSettingsManualProxyHelp
data.value: AdGuard will ignore the system proxy settings and will use the proxy settings specified here.

data.name: GeneralSettingsNoProxyHelp
data.value: AdGuard will send requests directly, bypassing the proxy server, even if it's configured in system settings.

data.name: GeneralSettingsProxyAuthorizationDescription
data.value: If your proxy server requires authorization, please specify your login name and password below.

data.name: GeneralSettingsSelectUpdateChannelHelp
data.value: The update channels for AdGuard range from the most stable and tested (Release) to completely untested and likely least stable (Nightly). If you are interested in seeing what's next, with minimal risk, the Beta channel is the place to be.

data.name: GeneralSettingsSilentUpdatesHelp
data.value: Defines whether AdGuard updates automatically when a new version is available.

data.name: GeneralSettingsUseSystemProxySettingsHelp
data.value: AdGuard will automatically determine whether a proxy server has been defined in the system settings.

data.name: GeneralSettingsWfpDriverHelp
data.value: WFP network driver provides Modern UI application filtering in Windows 8 and later.

data.name: InstallCustomFilterDialogErrorWhileInstalling
data.value: Error while processing the custom filter

data.name: InstalledUserscriptsDescriptionText
data.value: You can enable some of the pre-installed extensions or add any userscript manually.

data.name: LanguageChangeWarningDescription
data.value: To apply changes and switch to a new language, AdGuard has to restart. Restart now?

data.name: LicenseDialogActivateLicenseHelp
data.value: Enter your license key and click this button to activate the license. You need an activated license to use AdGuard.

data.name: LicenseDialogCheckLicenseHelp
data.value: Check the current status of your license.

data.name: LicenseDialogPurchaseLicenseHelp
data.value: Visit the AdGuard official website to extend your license or purchase a new one.

data.name: LicenseDialogRefreshLicenseHelp
data.value: Click this button to update the information on current license.

data.name: LicenseDialogResetLicenseHelp
data.value: Resets the current license. Once done, the reset license can be used on any other computer.

data.name: LicenseDialogRestoreLicenseHelp
data.value: You can find all your license keys in your personal account on the AdGuard official website.

data.name: LicenseExpired
data.value: License has expired. Protection is disabled. You need to renew your license key.

data.name: LicenseExpiredTileViewDiscountText
data.value: Get The Best Premium Ad Blocker For Any Device!

data.name: MainWindowAdBlockerDescription
data.value: module blocks all ads and pop-ups on the websites you visit.

data.name: MainWindowAdguardExtensionsDescription
data.value: module works as a cross-browser userscript manager to extend websites functionality. You can enable some of the default extensions or install any userscript manually.

data.name: MainWindowBrowsingSecurityDescription
data.value: module protects you from malicious and phishing websites.

data.name: MainWindowFiltersDatabaseHaveNotBeenLoad
data.value: Filter databases have not been loaded

data.name: MainWindowFiltersWereUpdated
data.value: Filters were checked for updates {0} ago

data.name: MainWindowParentalControlDescription
data.value: module provides an easy and convenient way to protect your kids when they are online.

data.name: MainWindowResoringService
data.value: We are working on restoring the service.

data.name: MainWindowRestoringProtection
data.value: We are working on re-enabling protection.

data.name: MainWindowSummaryProtectionDisabled
data.value: Protection is disabled. Updates are unavailable.

data.name: NetworkSettingsAdguardHttpProxy
data.value: Use AdGuard as an HTTP proxy

data.name: NetworkSettingsAdguardHttpProxyHelp
data.value: AdGuard will not automatically intercept your application traffic. To enable internet traffic filtering, you need to manually configure your browser to use AdGuard as a proxy server.

data.name: NetworkSettingsAutomaticallyFilterTrafficHelp
data.value: AdGuard will automatically filter all your Internet traffic using its network driver.

data.name: NetworkSettingsCheckingProxyError
data.value: The proxy is dead or the configuration is invalid

data.name: NetworkSettingsDescription
data.value: Network settings for filtering, application & filter updates, and HTTPS settings as well

data.name: NetworkSettingsFilterHttpsConfirmationDescription
data.value: Warning! A lot of popular websites (like YouTube, Facebook etc.) use HTTPS and will show ads if you disable this option.

data.name: NetworkSettingsHttpPortHelp
data.value: Don't forget to configure your browser to use AdGuard as a proxy server, accessible at 127.0.0.1 and using a port you specified for it.

data.name: NetworkSettingsHttpsProtocolHelp
data.value: AdGuard will filter secure (HTTPS) connections if this checkbox is checked.

data.name: NetworkSettingsIgnoreEvCertificates
data.value: Do not filter websites with EV certificates

data.name: NetworkSettingsIgnoreEvCertificatesHelp
data.value: Extended Validation (EV) SSL Certificates offer a stronger guarantee for which the owner of the website passed a thorough and globally-standardized identity verification process defined within the EV guidelines.

data.name: NetworkSettingsIgnoreEvConfirmationDescription
data.value: You may need to restart the web browser for this setting to be properly applied.

data.name: NetworkSettingsManualProxyHelp
data.value: AdGuard will ignore the system proxy settings and will use the proxy settings specified here.

data.name: NetworkSettingsNoProxyHelp
data.value: AdGuard will send requests directly, bypassing the proxy server, even if it's configured in system settings.

data.name: NetworkSettingsProxyAuthorizationDescription
data.value: If your proxy server requires authorization, please specify your login name and password below.

data.name: NetworkSettingsProxySettingsDescription
data.value: Using these proxy settings AdGuard will update filters, get new versions, etc.

data.name: NetworkSettingsReinstallCertificateAlertDescription
data.value: To perform this operation all browsers will be automatically closed.

data.name: NetworkSettingsReinstallCertificateProgressText
data.value: Please wait, the operation can take up to 60 seconds...

data.name: NetworkSettingsSwitchDriverConfirmationDescription
data.value: PC reboot may be required for proper change.

data.name: NetworkSettingsUseSystemProxySettingsHelp
data.value: AdGuard will automatically determine whether a proxy server has been defined in the system settings.

data.name: NetworkSettingsWfpDriverHelp
data.value: WFP network driver provides Modern UI applications filtering in Windows versions 8 and later.

data.name: NoWebBrowser_Caption
data.value: The default web browser was not found

data.name: NoWebBrowser_Message
data.value: Could not complete these actions because of an incorrect installation of the default web browser.

data.name: NotValidLicenseError
data.value: The license key has expired, is blocked, or does not exist.

data.name: ParentalControlSettingsDescription
data.value: The parental control module provides an easy and convenient way to protect your children when they're online. Enable it for the computer users you want to be protected.

data.name: ParentalControlSettingsEnableHelp
data.value: Enable or disable Parental Control module.

data.name: ParentalControlSettingsExecFilesHelp
data.value: If this option is enabled, Parental Control blocks all executable (.exe) file downloads. This prevents your child from downloading and installing software on this computer.

data.name: ParentalControlSettingsPasswordHelp
data.value: The password protects from changing AdGuard settings or closing the program. The password is also used to enter the websites that are blocked by AdGuard's Parental Control.

data.name: ParentalControlSettingsSafeSearchHelp
data.value: If Safe Search is enabled, the websites containing pornography, explicit erotic content and other unacceptable materials are excluded from search results of all popular search engines (Google, Bing, Yahoo).

data.name: ParentalControlSettingsSensitivityHelp
data.value: The sites that are accessible by protected users depend on the Parental Control sensitivity level.

data.name: ParentalControlUsersDescription
data.value: You can choose which users are protected with Parental Control. Just select your children's accounts by checking the respective checkboxes.

data.name: PasswordDialogEnterPasswordDescription
data.value: Please enter the password. A password prevents anyone from changing AdGuard settings or closing the program. It is also required to visit a website blocked by AdGuard Parental Control.

data.name: PasswordProtectionDialogDescription
data.value: A password prevents other people from changing AdGuard settings or closing the program. It is also required to visit a website blocked by AdGuard Parental Control.

data.name: PasswordProtectionDialogEmptyPassword
data.value: Leave new password text field empty to disable password protection.

data.name: PopupConnectionErrorDescription
data.value: An error occurred while using the AdGuard service.\nIf the error persists, please contact technical support.

data.name: ProgressDialogAdvancedSettingsSaved
data.value: Advanced settings have been successfully saved!

data.name: ProgressDialogAdvancedSettingsSavingError
data.value: Error while saving advanced settings. The operation was interrupted

data.value: Error while exporting log records. The operation was interrupted.

data.name: ProgressDialogImportingSettingsError
data.value: Error while importing settings. The operation was interrupted

data.value: The license has been checked successfully!

data.value: The log records have been imported successfully!

data.value: Error while resetting settings to defaults. The operation was interrupted.

data.name: ProgressDialogResettingUserscriptsToDefaultsError
data.value: Error while resetting userscripts to defaults. The operation was interrupted.

data.name: ProgressDialogSettingsExported
data.value: The settings have been exported successfully!

data.name: ProgressDialogSettingsImported
data.value: The settings have been imported successfully!

data.name: SettingsUpgradeFailedPopupText
data.value: The upgrading of settings has failed, and settings have been restored to "{0}"

data.name: StealthModeSettingsBlockCookieHelp
data.value: Cookies are small text files. Web sites may cause your browser to store them, if you do not prevent it, and may then track you while you are surfing.

data.name: StealthModeSettingsBlockFirstPartyCookieHelp
data.value: This option works the same way as 'Self-destruction of third-party cookies', but for requests from the current website.

data.name: StealthModeSettingsBlockFirstPartyCookiePeriodHelp
data.value: Set the time interval here (in minutes). All first-party cookies will self-destroy when they have been alive for this period. Set to '0' to block cookies completely.

data.name: StealthModeSettingsBlockFlashHelp
data.value: The Flash Player plugin has become increasingly vulnerable to online threats like viruses and hackers and can also have a significant negative impact on loading time for websites. When this setting is on, AdGuard blocks browsers' ability to detect components (like plugins and ActiveXObject objects) that allow Flash to display content. This effectively means that browsers are unable to support Flash.

data.name: StealthModeSettingsBlockJavaHelp
data.value: Some websites and web services still use old technology of supporting Java plugins. The API, which is the basis of Java plugins, has serious security issues. You can disable such plugins for security purposes. Nevertheless, even if you decide to use "Block Java" option, Javascript will still be enabled.

data.name: StealthModeSettingsBlockLocationApiHelp
data.value: Enabling this option will block the browser geolocation feature, which otherwise can detect your location and use this information to prioritize specific search results, or make other various suggestions based on it.

data.name: StealthModeSettingsBlockPushApiHelp
data.value: The Push API gives browsers the ability to receive messages from a server. What this effectively means is that the browser will be able to show various notifications, no matter whether it is in the foreground, or if it is even currently launched. Enable this option to block browser Push API.

data.name: StealthModeSettingsBlockThirdPartyAuthorizationHelp
data.value: Authorization header value is cached by the browser, and then is sent alongside every request to that domain. It means that it can be used for tracking purposes just like cookies.

data.name: StealthModeSettingsBlockThirdPartyAuthorizationWarning
data.value: Warning! Some applications (web-browser extensions) may use authorization headers during the work, and their functionality may be broken by enabling this setting.

data.name: StealthModeSettingsBlockThirdPartyCookieHelp
data.value: Cookies are small text files. Web sites may cause your browser to store them, if you do not prevent it, and may then track you while you are surfing.

data.name: StealthModeSettingsBlockThirdPartyCookiePeriodHelp
data.value: Set the time interval here (in minutes). All third-party cookies will self-destroy when they have been alive for this period. Set to '0' to block cookies completely.

data.name: StealthModeSettingsBlockWebRtcHelp
data.value: WebRTC is a communication protocol that can leak your actual IP address from behind your proxy or VPN.

data.name: StealthModeSettingsCustomIpHelp
data.value: Enter here the IP address you want to be shown instead of your real IP. Leave this field empty to use default IP address.

data.name: StealthModeSettingsCustomRefererHelp
data.value: You can set a custom referrer to be used instead of the default. Leave the field empty to use the default referrer value.

data.name: StealthModeSettingsCustomUserAgentHelp
data.value: You can set a custom user-agent to be used instead of the default. Leave the field empty to use the default generic user-agent value.

data.name: StealthModeSettingsDisableCahceHelp
data.value: Websites may mark arbitrary pages on page load, thereby so-called ETags are used. As long as the respective site remains in your browser cache, the mark is sent on any new request to the website again.

data.name: StealthModeSettingsDoNotTrackHelp
data.value: The Do-Not-Track (DNT) header is the proposed HTTP header field that requests that a web application disables either its tracking or cross-site user tracking of an individual user.

data.name: StealthModeSettingsEnableHelp
data.value: Enable this module to protect your data from tracking.

data.name: StealthModeSettingsHideIpHelp
data.value: Stealth Mode cannot completely hide your IP-address but can disguise you so that the website you visit will take you for a proxy server. This helps in some cases, and a website ignores your real IP.

data.name: StealthModeSettingsHideQueriesHelp
data.value: Hides the search query from the website to which you navigated via search results of Google, Yahoo, Yandex, Bing etc.

data.name: StealthModeSettingsHideReferrerHelp
data.value: Hides the current website from third-parties by replacing Referer HTTP header.

data.name: StealthModeSettingsHideUserAgentHelp
data.value: This option allows you to alter your User Agent. By default we simply strip your existing User-Agent of everything 'extra', but you can enter a completely different one.

data.name: StealthModeSettingsStripUrlHelp
data.value: If this option is enabled, AdGuard strips the pages' URLs of tracking parameters like utm_*, fb_ref, etc.

data.name: StealthModeSettingsTitleDescription
data.value: Protects your identity and sensitive personal info from thousands of online trackers

data.name: StealthModeSettingsXClientData
data.value: Remove X-Client-Data header from HTTP requests

data.name: StealthModeSettingsXClientDataHelp
data.value: Google Chrome includes a special header identifying your browser in all requests sent to Google domains including DoubleClick and Google Analytics.

data.name: StealthModeValidUserAgents
data.value: Get valid user agents at whatismybrowser.com

data.name: SupportDialogDescription
data.value: Here you can contact the technical support department.

data.name: SupportDialogDescriptionParagraph
data.value: Please use your actual email address so that we can respond to your message.

data.name: SupportDialogDiagnosticReport
data.value: Include the diagnostic report in the message

data.name: SupportDialogDiagnosticReportHelp
data.value:
The diagnostic report contains: 
- list of running processes 
- detailed information about AdGuard settings, including enabled filters and installed userscripts 
- application logs

data.name: TaskbarMenuDebugLogDescription
data.value: It can slow down AdGuard filtering. Are you sure?

data.name: TaskbarMenuExitWarningText
data.value: You are going to exit AdGuard. Do you want to let the service run in the background to keep the filters and program up to date?

data.name: TaskbarMenuResetSettingsDescription
data.value: You need to restart AdGuard to reset the settings. Restart now?

data.name: TrayUpdateSuccessBallonMessageFormat
data.value: Number of filters and extensions updated: {0}

data.name: TrialExpired
data.value: Trial has expired. Protection is disabled. You need to purchase a license key.

data.name: TrialExpiringPopupText
data.value: {0} until protection is disabled. Purchase a license to keep blocking ads.

data.name: UnknowCertificateDetectedPopupDescription
data.value: The process "{0}" has detected an unknown CA certificate. Click to reinstall the certificate into the app's own storage

data.name: UnsafePopupDescription
data.value: AdGuard Browsing Security Module has blocked a request to a potentially dangerous website.

data.name: UpdateSuccessBallonMessageFormat
data.value: AdGuard has been successfully updated to version {0}

data.name: UserFilterDescription
data.value: An ad filter that you create on your own. You can add rules to it manually or using the AdGuard Assistant extension.

data.name: UserscriptInstallDialogDescription
data.value: Enter the valid URL or file path of the extension userscript into the input box below. The userscript will be installed as an AdGuard extension.

data.name: UserscriptSettingsDetectUserscriptDescription
data.value: If enabled, AdGuard will detect any requests to userscripts and suggest to install them

data.name: UserscriptSettingsEnableDescription
data.value: Enable or disable the extensions module

data.name: WizardAdBlockerAutoActivateHelp
data.value: AdGuard will automatically enable the most appropriate filters for your region.

data.name: WizardAndroidDescriptionText
data.value: Removes ads in apps and browsers, protects your privacy, and helps you manage your apps. Scan QR code to install.

data.name: WizardAssistantDescription
data.value: With Assistant you can manage the filtering process right from the browser: hide any element, control ad blocking, send a report.

data.name: WizardCustomizeButton
data.value: You can choose filters you need

data.name: WizardExtensionsDescriptionText
data.value: Our cutting-edge browser extensions will help you enjoy AdGuard protection at its best.

data.name: WizardFishingBlockMaliciousSites
data.value: Restrict access to fraudulent and infected sites

data.name: WizardNetworkConfirmationText
data.value: Then the https websites won’t be filtered. Are you sure?

data.name: WizardPhishingDescriptionText
data.value: Prevents you from visiting all kinds of hazardous websites: malware, phishing and fraud. Our databases are always up-to-date.

data.name: WizardPopupsConfirmationText
data.value: The ad-blocker module will be disabled, which means AdGuard will not remove ads. Are you sure?

data.name: WizardPopupsDescriptionText
data.value: AdGuard excels at blocking ads. We have been setting industry standards for years and have accumulated vast experience.

data.name: WizardPrivacyComfortDescription
data.value: Blocks all known trackers and analytics.

data.name: WizardPrivacyDescriptionText
data.value: Thousands of corporations track all your online actions and use this data to target you with ads. AdGuard easily fights them all!

data.name: WizardPrivacyHighDescription
data.value: Deletes tracking parameters from URLs. Limits the life session of third-party cookies.

data.name: WizardPrivacyHighWarning
data.value: You may have to re-login to websites from time to time

data.name: WizardPrivacyUltimateDescription
data.value: Limits the time-to-live (TTL) of all cookies, including first-party. Disables browser functions that can be used for tracking purposes.

data.name: WizardPrivacyUltimateWarning
data.value: Some websites may start working incorrectly

data.name: WizardProtectionDescriptionText
data.value: Configure filtering of secure connections with AdGuard.

data.name: WizardWelcomeDescriptionText
data.value: Congratulations! AdGuard has been successfully installed and is protecting you from ads. Would you like to personalize protection?

data.name: WizardWidgetsDescriptionText
data.value: AdGuard is able to filter any type of content, and you can fine-tune the filtering to exactly suit your needs.

data.name: WizardWidgetsRemoveChatsHelp
data.value: Basically, any elements that might distract you from the website's content and are not essential to its functionality.
